001package edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.adapter;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.View;
006import android.view.ViewGroup;
007import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
008import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
009import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder;
010import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.databinding.ItemCardBinding;
011import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.model.domain.Card;
012import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.model.domain.Card.Rank;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.model.domain.Card.Suit;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Map;
016
017public class HandAdapter extends RecyclerView.Adapter<ViewHolder> {
018
019  private final List<Card> cardList;
020  private final LayoutInflater layoutInflater;
021  private final Map<Rank, Integer> rankDrawables;
022  private final Map<Suit, Integer> suitColors;
023  private final OnCardClickListener onCardClickListener;
024
025  /**
026   * Constructs a new HandAdapter instance.
027   *
028   * @param context            The context in which the adapter is running, used for layout inflation and resource access.
029   * @param cardList          A list of Card objects to be displayed by the adapter.
030   * @param rankDrawables     A map that associates each Rank with its corresponding drawable resource ID for card representation.
031   * @param suitColors        A map that associates each Suit with its corresponding color resource ID for card representation.
032   * @param onCardClickListener The listener that will be notified when a card is clicked.
033   */
034  public HandAdapter(Context context, List<Card> cardList, Map<Rank, Integer> rankDrawables,
035      Map<Suit, Integer> suitColors, OnCardClickListener onCardClickListener) {
036    this.cardList = cardList;
037    layoutInflater = LayoutInflater.from(context);
038    this.rankDrawables = rankDrawables;
039    this.suitColors = suitColors;
040    this.onCardClickListener = onCardClickListener;
041  }
042
043  @NonNull
044  @Override
045  public ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull ViewGroup parent, int viewType) {
046    return new Holder(ItemCardBinding.inflate(layoutInflater, parent, false));
047  }
048
049  @Override
050  public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull ViewHolder holder, int position) {
051    Card card = cardList.get(position);
052
053    ((Holder) holder).bind(position, card);
054  }
055
056  @Override
057  public int getItemCount() {
058    return cardList.size();
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Handles the event when an item in the card list is clicked.
063   *
064   * This method retrieves the Card at the specified position in the card list and notifies that the item at this position has changed, prompting the adapter to refresh its view.
065   *
066   * @param position The position of the clicked item in the card list.
067   * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the specified position is out of range
068   *                                    (position < 0 || position >= cardList.size()).
069   */
070  public void onItemClicked(int position) {
071    Card c = cardList.get(position);
072    notifyItemChanged(position);
073  }
074
075  private class Holder extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder {
076
077    private final ItemCardBinding binding;
078
079    Holder(ItemCardBinding binding) {
080      super(binding.getRoot());
081      this.binding = binding;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Binds the data from the specified Card to the view at the given position.
086     *
087     * This method updates the card image, applies a color filter based on the card's suit, sets the content description, and configures the visibility of the selection indicator.
088     *
089     * @param position The position of the item within the adapter.
090     * @param card     The Card object containing the data to bind to the view.
091     */
092    public void bind(int position, Card card) {
093      //noinspection DataFlowIssue
094      int drawableId = rankDrawables.get(card.getRank());
095
096      binding.cardImage.setImageResource(drawableId);
097
098      if (card.getSuit() != null) {
099        binding.cardImage.setColorFilter(suitColors.get(card.getSuit()));
100      }
101
102      String description =  card.getRank().toString() + " of ";
103      description += (card.getSuit() != null) ? card.getSuit().toString() : "WILD";
104
105      if (card.isSelectedByUser()) {
106        binding.selectedCard.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
107      } else {
108        binding.selectedCard.setVisibility(View.INVISIBLE);
109      }
110      binding.cardImage.setContentDescription(description);
111      binding.getRoot().setOnClickListener((v) -> {
112        onCardClickListener.onCardClick(position, card);
113      });
114    }
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * A functional interface for handling card click events.
119   *
120   * <p>This interface defines a single method, onCardClick(int, Card), which is called when a card is clicked. Implementations of this interface can define the behavior that should occur upon a card click.</p>
121   */
122  @FunctionalInterface
123  public interface OnCardClickListener {
124
125    void onCardClick(int position, Card newSelectedCard);
126  }
127}
128
